comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1
Build ID: 20110707182747

Steps to reproduce:

Visited a site with a Javascript hidden password input form.

http://www.radiotimes.com/ListingsServlet?event=13&broadcastType=1&jspGridLocation=/jsp/tv_listings_grid.jsp&jspListLocation=/jsp/tv_listings_single.jsp&jspError=/jsp/error.jsp

Restore down Firefox window.

Click & dragged one of the links to my desktop to create a shortcut.

Before I released the LMB, the "Please Enter The Master Password For The Software Security Device" window appeared. This blocks the creation of the shortcut, and makes FF unresponsive to mouse clicks. The form is navigateable with the keyboard to input the password or select cancel.


Actual results:

Before I released the LMB, the "Please Enter The Master Password For The Software Security Device" window appeared. This blocks the creation of the shortcut after releasing LMB, and makes FF unresponsive to mouse clicks. The password input form is navigateable with the keyboard to input the password or select cancel.


Expected results:

The Software Security Device popup should not block the creation of the shortcut, or be unresponsive to mouse clicks after releasing the LMB to drop the shortcut.
